projects.name: Apparatus and Method for Detecting Deterioration Module or Deteriorated Cell of Bettery
projects.summary: This project develops a diagnostic and monitoring technology for large-scale Energy Storage Systems (ESS) to identify degraded battery cells or modules using historical Battery Management System (BMS) operation data. The approach applies condition-based statistical analysis to voltage and current behavior under charge, discharge, and idle states, enabling early detection of degradation trends beyond conventional real-time threshold methods. The system also considers integration with IEC 61850, a communication standard that supports standardized and interoperable data exchange among power and energy system devices, thereby enhancing system-level monitoring, safety, and battery lifecycle management.
highlights: Condition-based degradation detection using charge, discharge, and idle operational states
Statistical histogram analysis of voltage deviation and cell position over long-term operation
Multi-level degradation diagnosis (Interest, Caution, Alarm, Fault)
Early fault prediction and fire-risk prevention for large-scale ESS
Support for battery lifetime management and recycling screening
